Description: Rim sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band around rim, glazed below (fired mostly red and worn); top of rim painted; exterior: at rim, two narrow bands, and one near bottom of sherd.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

According to Dupont and Thomas (2006, p. 79, NAU33), the geophysical characteristics of the fabric indicate that the sherd originated in Chios, despite the high manganese content. The sample number is written in ink 'NAU 33' on break. For parallels with other chalices, see British Museum 1924,1201.161.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 302, pl. 152) (Number not precise (possibly no. 1107))
Dupont & Thomas 2006 / Naukratis: Les Importations Grecques Orientales Archaïques (p. 78-79, 82-83, fig. 1) (NAU 33)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1211) (phase 2)
